newsitem.title: UK: Telewest, Gen Cable silent on report.
newsitem.headline: Telewest, Gen Cable silent on report.

text.p: Cable television firms Telewest and General Cable declined to comment on Friday on a report that they were discussing a possible merger or alliance, which analysts said could further consolidate UK's cable industry.

The Evening Standard newspaper reported on Friday that both firms have been in talks since before the formation last month of Cable & Wireless Communication, out of Mercury Communications, Bell Cablemedia, Nynex CableComms and the UK operations of Videotron.
A Telewest spokesman said the company would not respond to "speculation...But we believe that the cable industry needs consolidation."
A General Cable spokesman also declined to comment.

The Cable & Wireless Communications deal fuelled speculation about further consolidation in the industry but analysts said a merged Telewest-General Cable entity would need to restructure operations before it could make a positive impact on investors.
"It will not be sufficient for them to just combine," said Oliver Eherenberg of Robert Fleming Securities.
Another City analyst said an alliance would benefit General Cable, boosting its network.
"If not Telewest, it would like to have some other smaller firm. It needs to expand," an analyst said.

General Cable's pretax losses for nine months to September 30 rose to 21.17 million stg from 16.04 million. Telewest also showed higher losses with its third quarter losses rising to 6.4 million stg from 3.5 million.

Analysts said that Telewest and General Cable could jointly provide telephony and television services which could undercut services of British Telecommunications Plc and British Sky Broadcasting Plc (BSkyB), the respective leaders.
